intro: Corispermum sibiricum subsp. amurense, commonly known as Siberian sandmat, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy, green or reddish leaves that help it conserve water. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically pollinated by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Corispermum sibiricum subsp. amurense is often found in steppes and deserts, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
